communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All LAUSD records which are Request For Proposal, Solicitations and corresponding contracts for Security and Defense Vendors/ Contractors.

I desire these records to better understand how it was in 2006 a student died at Venice Senior High and an investigation occured (According to several Press outlets) without the school premises being vacated or locked down at any stage during any attack that could have occured, or for the weeks following. 
Protocols regarding lockdown are apparent and whether or not they were followed should have been of keen interest to your Agency. 
If parents were not notified of the attack, or if students were allowed to investigate on campus in tandem with the press or other Agencies those Security tactics should be public knowledge. It should also be determined where responsibility was illegal or could have led to the attack itself. This information is of great value to all students and parents but also to those who seek budgetary constraints on certain forms of law enforcement.

These records of agreement, payment/exchange, bid, will serve as a directory and will provide means for third parties (person/organization/business/Agency) providing any form of security to LAUSD property to be rightfully contacted for questions and to release details pertaining to  educational communities historic protections, insurance, regulations regarding liaison with Law Enforcement Agencies, whether or not that occurred before-during-after the specific event referenced here, and all violent incidents prior/ those potentially occuring today.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf
